title: Football Manager 2019
review:
[h1]This is not a review, this is a 20year tribute to this Amazing game[/h1]

I have been a Fan of FM ever since 1999! I have been purchasing this game EVERY YEAR even if i don't get to play it just to support it. Unfortunately, i am not the saving the game discs type, otherwise i would have had all the collection from 1999 till now. Some of them were on different steam accounts others were on CD's others on DVD's.

I consider this game the most complete football experience you will ever get! Simply amazing, realistic and emotionally capable to successfully get you to love "a complete stranger"!
 I have been in love with Real Oviedo and have been a fan of it for 15 years (maybe more) just because of this game.

The only thing that disappoints me still is that i am still waiting to see an official release with my country's (CYPRUS) League.

Other than that, it's a 9.9/10 for me

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I've bought just about every Champ/Football Manager since about 2003. I have no pleasure is saying that this is unquestionably the worst edition since that time. Please keep in mind that i have THOUSANDS of hours in other FM games so any issues I point out are relative to other games, which have all had their fair share of problems. I'll try to run through the issues; 

-Performance is worse than FM18. It's by no means unplayable, but it is noticeably worse
-Bugs where you can't click on anything, or where for some bizarre reason only about 1 in 4 clicks register
-A match engine that actually beggars belief. Hit the woodwork 7 times in a match? Check. 50+ shots on goal in a match? Check. I could go on, it just sucks. People will probably read this and think "maybe your tactics suck", but if you are regularly getting 20+ shots on target and not scoring with a striker who has 18 finishing, I can't see how this could possibly be an issue with tactics. This is avoidable by meta-gaming but that isn't acceptable 
-Player interactions that are so unrealistic it is almost as if the person who wrote them has never had an adult conversation. In what world would a player respond by saying "maybe my standards are better than yours" when you praise him for being THE BEST PLAYER IN TRAINING THAT WEEK. He has a 9.10 rating in training in a game where a 7.6 match rating is Ballon d'Or territory but is willing to insult his manager for praising him? What the fuck

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Update: Game unplayable on Mac for over almost 2 MONTHS since the release of OS 10.14.4.

For context, the game was unplayable in week 32 of the EPL season. The FA Cup has just been played and the game is still broken.

How is it acceptable in any way, shape or form for a game to be unplayable on the 2nd biggest platform for 3 out of 6 months. 3  out of 6 months!!!!

The public beta is also a complete and utter load of BS designed to buy time so SI staff can take off for the Easter break while leaving their user base to twiddle their thumbs.

Looking forward to another stock comment from Neil Brock explaining that SI is 'working on it'.

Game unplayable on Mac since 19.2.2.
developer_response:
We've rolled out a fix for our public beta version as shown here - https://community.sigames.com/topic/465780-performancelag-problems-on-mac-post-1922/ 

As people have reported the issue is now resolved, we'll look to roll this update out to the full retail version as soon as we can. Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I very rarely leave reviews. That is because I don't regard myself competent in most of the video game genres. But it is different for football manament games. I have been playing in this genre since 1997. My addiction and love started with Premier Manager 97. Then follows the CM98/99, CM99/00. FM 2005 is still fresh in my memories. Hours of gameplay... Lots of soul breaking matches played...

And now it is FM 19. I pre-ordered it. Big expectations. Bang. Incorrect squad registration roles for Turkish League. Totally unplayable in Turkey. I said ok. Football is universal. Go play somewhere else until they fix it. Took my favourite team in BPL which is Liverpool. Bang! Salah is injured for 11 months during a pre-season match. Re-started the game. Bang! Mane is gone for 9 months. Re-started the game. Bang! Salah is gone 7 months. I said ok, I will keep playing this time. 27 players in the squad. Total injuries were 145 throughout the season. Salah couldn't play a single match. Sturridge played 25 matches and scored 4 goals. The most shocking thing was I became the champion with 11 matches lost and 7 draws. I said ok. This is a pre-release game. They will fix it. They always did.

But no. Not this time they did. Last time I checked I am in 90 hours in this game. The further I came with a team without deleting the save is fifth match in the second season. Here is why;

1. Poor match engine optimisation
- Your striker is very unlikely to score in one on one situations. And by unlikely I mean %5-10. 
- Your probabilty to score goals from rigth wing/left wing crosses are much higher than to score a goal from the penalty kick.
- During a highlight you are very likely to see that one of your players is running completely opposite way from where everything is happening. Sometimes it is same for the other team's players.
- You can easily bet your home on that if your defenders started to pass the ball back and forth, you will concede a goal.

2. Poor VAR optimisation
- Around %90 of the key moments in a match contains a VAR situation
- The refs very unlikely to give a penalty decision without consulting the VAR.

3. Player's penalty
I call this "player's penaly". Let me explaing what I mean. 
You take Chelsea. Trying to land a big name. You offer a big sum of cash. Rejected. The same transfer season your rival lands the same player for less. In another save you are Man City. You are after the same player. Offered a big sum. Gets rejected. Chelsea signs that player for less. 
Same scenario is also valid while negotaiting with a player. You offer 4m euro per year to a player. Gets rejected. Same player signs a contract with an AI managed club for 2m euros.
One question here is very necessary. WTF?

4. Translations (You don't have to read this part if your mother tongue is not Turkish)
- Since the first Turkish translation is introduced, I have been forcing myself to play it in Turkish. But after a few continues, I go back to English. The very first time it was introduced, the translation was disgustingly bad. I don't remember the year, I think it was 2014. Clearly a google translation. In comparison, now it is a lot better this year. But still there is a major problem with the translation that must be addressed. And that is; I don't feel myself that I am reading the news from a Turkish newspaper or conducting a interview with the Turkish media or listening the commentary from a Turkish commentator.
It feels like a word to word translation of an English sportsman commentating or asking questions. What I mean by that is there is no translation of the jargon. It is like you read a translation of your new rented property's contract. Just word by word. Even the English idioms or figurative phrases are translated to Turkish word by word which doesn't make any sense when you read them in Turkish. 
"They leave with a win in their bags" 
What bags? They brought their own bags before the game? Interesting huh?
I mean no offense to English culture and literature here. But this doesn't give me the same vibe when I play in Turkish.

5. Unjustified buzz before the release
- On youtube I watched so many videos about the new purple background and a new picture in the introduction page and also a new layout in the menu.
The purple background; it is just a skin
The new picture(s) in the intro; just a picture
The new layout; took me 3 seconds to adjust

I am a veteran FM player and don't give a fuchsia about any of these.


With all being said, I will probably keep playing the game as it is the only AAA game in this genre. But I can't recommend this game anymore. I don't even recognize it as a game. It became a database for real proffesional football clubs with some 3d match engine in it.


Update on 13.05.2019

Deleted
developer_response: We are aware of the issue and hope to address it as soon as possible. Apologies you've encountered the issue in the beta.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
My last Football Manager was FM2011. Lots of features have changed since then. Definitely the UI has changed to accommodate the additional features, the tactic are more complex and the match graphics and engine has improved (at least on the surface)

Pros:
- Nice match day graphics
- Many options for tactics
- Lots of things to keep the manager busy
- You can choose which areas to handle so that you do not feel overwhelmed by too many things to handle.

Cons:
- Gameplay feels a bit too easy. I basically choose the same strategy that seems logical to me and do not deviate much throughout the season.
- The team talk is a mystery to me. It is hard to determine how a player will react to what you say until you try it.
- Absolutely hated that the players took long breaks post season, and are unavailable for the pre-season friendlies.
- if you choose to handle everything on your own, the game starts to feel like a full time job.

As with any FM game in the series, I usually do not buy every release of the game (every year). I hope that the developer may release just data updates and improve the engine rather than come up with a new version each time.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Good game in general, but I wouldn't say this is the best football manager ever.

I was hesitated to buy the game as there are bunch of players said it is not possible to score in open-plays. I was worried for a second about this, and this really happened during my first few matches of the season, the team only know how to score from set pieces.
Things have been changed significantly since I focus on building team cohesion and keeping a good relationship with my players. The team is having a good spirit and players are willing to give out their best in every match. I didn't mean not to bring in your tactics and philosophies to the team, this is equally important. You might find a huge turnaround when you put your time on team building, relationship bonding with your players and tactics preparation altogether.

The other thing you need to bear in mind is Training. Try to focus more on match tactics preparation and general training, you might find something special from these features. 

So after I applied these changes and focusing on these bits, I scored a lot from open plays, set-pieces still playing a part in the game but it is not as important as you imagined. Things doesn't come under your control immediately, take some time to familiar with the game and bring in your philosophies step-by-step, you might get a decent result from every matches.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I was really looking forward to fm19 this year with the tactical overhaul making the game  theoretically more in line with the terminology used by teams and pundits alike. 

Unfortunately, I can't help but feel Sports Interactive are just as controversial with their match engine and company standpoint on it as VAR has been recently.

Upon release the game was very enjoyable and tactical tweaks seemed very intuitive,  however since the recent ME updates have been rolled out, pressing is akin to watching my friends under 5s team swarming towards the ball with no regards to keeping shape. Through balls and off the ball runs are seemingly non apparent, and crossing - possibly my biggest hate of this years game, a wing back in acres of space with all the time in the world will stand and wait for the opposition to close them down 9/10 times, either resulting in a corner or throw.

I think the most irritating thing of all though is the Sports Interactive forum stance on these well known issues according to moderators that regulate the forums - the official response I have seen on several occasions is ''send us more PKM's of these known issues and we will look to balance this better in fm2020''.
Bearing in mind there is probably 6+ months left in this game's cycle, not to mention it was a much better working product at release SI have seriously dropped the ball with this edition of football manager - and I worry its going to take a minor miracle in the match engine department to tempt me to fork out another £40 or so for next years game, when if this year is anything to go by, any match engine tweaks will cause more harm than good and render any purchase a waste of time.

Overall I would definitely give fm18 a go if you have never tried it, but in all seriousness avoid this years game and hope for a better balanced, realistic interpretation of football in fm2020 as far as the match engine is concerned.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Lets get the bad out of the way first... My biggest gripe.
Lots of bugs carrying on over the years..
Grey players you sign, never originate at your club according to their bio. This has always been an issue.
When playing online with a friend only the host will see the kits graphics files. Yes, we have graphics files installed on both. Always an issue.
Over the net play is getting slower and more lag each year.
Despite changing my avatars skin colour, I'm still white on the sideline during the game. A small thing but hey, with the depth and detail of the game and you notice it.

Good game when played with friends online. This gives it the potential to be the greatest sports game ever!
Very good editor, once you know how to drive it. It's worth learning! Can make some amazing tournaments, awards, media outlets and more. This really adds depth that no other football management game touches. Although SI games should make sure that each year edited database is compatible with the last. This avoids the grief of having to re-create the leagues. Which I had to this year, even though I tried moving raw data etc as per forum work arounds, data still got corrupted. My leagues and tournaments are about 30 to 40 hours of work in them.
3D engine is chipping away with improvements each year and version. Matches are getting very watchable and you yell at the players, this is a good sign. The explosive gloves of goalkeepers of 2019 is a tad weird where the ball can fly off the gloves harder than the ball hit them.
The Social Feed (Twitter replica) and News tabloids are very good and I'm sure will only get better with each version.

What I think the game needs...
Does need a stadium editor. Yes, we know managers almost always don't do this. 
You should be able to take a tour of your stadium. It's your club or your employer!
Journalists need to be more involved and dynamic moving to other media outlets etc. With avatars
I really would like to be fat as a manager and yes eventually forced into retirement. Making yourself short and heavy, turns you into a brick. I want to be grossly fat. You can pass Methuselah in age and still be calling the shots. At a certain point, you should hang up the clip board and have your spirit possess a more age appropriate manager.

If you love watching football then its most likely you will love this game.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
The AI in this version of the game is absurd, borderline cheating. 
A) I have yet to see the opposition defence head the ball in to my players path. However it is every game, several times, that my RBs and CDs do this, which results in a goal conceded. The AI defence traps the ball or let's it go over it's head, as a human would.
B) Gifting goals to the opposition when it feels like it. Regardless of tactics or any sort of realism.
I could go on but i'm too angry. I believe there are exploits out there or cheats whatever. I don't know what they are but I bet the AI cheats because it knows humans will or simply load the game up again. I don't blame anyone for doing that.
I doubt any of this is new, news. It's all too much like a chore playing this game.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: An Excellent improvement to the series in so many different ways. 4.99/5.0. What continues to infuriate me is Goalkeeper training. The drop down menu for individual focus is the same for outfield players as well as goalkeepers. though it's greyed out. It would be good if you could train with communication, confidence, handling, command of area, one on ones, reflexes, throwing, kicking. Instead of the physical attributes like endurance, agility and balance, strength etc. You can coach anything at anytime in reality, its down to the individual to improve or not, but the option should always be there to strengthen Goalkeepers specifically.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Previously I wrote a big essay on the reasons this game is bad. However the flaws are countless and very obvious. In short THIS GAME IS TRASH. Don't waste your money on it and support the laziest games devs I have come across.

My main issue with the game is not the shitty calamity errors that happen but the fact that you cant play attacking football. Most of the goals come from set pieces or counters. In my opinion the most fun part of a manager simulator is to make attractive attacking football. By having a game that seems to be against good football? You cant have fun. SI NEEDS to realise flaws in a game are fine, as long as the game is fun. The game in its current bland state is not fun.

If you want the same experience without having to pay for a full price game, then get yourself some dice. Yep that's all you need! Mind you it would have to be a dice that is biased towards the computer/AI.
 
I urge everyone who has bought this game to never buy another version till SI get their heads out the sand and makes a proper game!!!!!!!!!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Not for serious gamers.

The match engine is absolutely terrible and looks tailored towards new players and kids. SI is dumbing down the ME every year. The ME is harcoded to the extend where you have no control over advanced tactics. The company wants you to play the game the way THEY understand the football, which is old school English style crossing and direct football. I highly doubt their development team's understanding of  modern football and tactics because it is non-existent in the game. 

- You have no control over build up play. The central attacking midfielders keep dropping deep because they hard-coded to do so by the developers. They don't understand the build up play. PERIOD.

- The defensive positioning of your players are hard-coded and depends on your player roles 'in possession' instructions. Seriously? Who came up with this genius idea? So if you want your strikers to drop deep when you don't have possession, you can't assign them 'attack' duty because apparently only support duty strikers drop deep. Is this how teams which use narrow 4-4-2 in real life play? No, they don't. The defensive positioning should be INDEPENDENT of your 'in possession' instructions.

- You can't recreact Sane and Sterling roles because in FM they don't stay wide in the final third. The wide attackers roles are hard-coded to stay inside no matter which role you use, no matter how much space is available out wide. In short, you can't create Man City's tactics. PERIOD.

- All wingbacks are hard-coded to dribble with the ball like dumb brainless non-existent league footballers. You can't recreact majority of wingback roles from real life. 

- You have no control over pressing. No pressing triggers. Pressing is hard-coded to the very basic.

There are so many other issues that you can't take the match engine seriously. The developers don't understand modern football tactics.

title: Football Manager 2019

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
There are aspects of the game which seem complicated simply for the sake of it whereas other aspects are over simplified. Back in the day, the team tactics seemed far more detailed and involved than what this version gives you to play. On the other hand, training seems annoyingly repetitive and overly involved. Weekly setups are great for about...a week! Then it just gets tiresome. 

This is the first FM I've played in about 8 years and I have to say, I much prefer that 8 year old version to this. 

Biggest gripe though - lack of Premier League licensing.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: Great potential, & on the right path, but the animations are laughable at best. The AI's decision making is blatantly just borderline disrespectful in it's thoughtlessness, & for every amazing thing this game does, it does something else that makes you question your investment in it. The worst part is the fun parts of the game require a great deal of time, so you'll be sucked into it before you realize most of the tweaks, adjustments, & game planning  you make/do have less impact than what you say to a "devious" reporter about how you feel about the weather.

Frist of all the graphics suck, YES deal with it, its the same shit graphics from 5+ years ago, they change some interface in the tactics screen and training and charge people 60 for the same game from 5+ years ago. The roles in tactics dont even do what they say, you have to fucking find out what they actually do, wasting your time to find a tactic that works, then you have that utterly shit match engine where your team shoots a million times, YES with clear cut chances and everything plus chance conversion training (i tried everything) but no they dont score but the fucking AI goes on to attack once shoots and there you go they score! Not to mention that your team doesnt do what you say to do, they dont stay wide, work the ball in etc even if you change everything in the tactics and individual assignments to do so, I actually dont even have words to describe the lack of intelligence this dev. team has or they are just assholes that dont fucking care and only want to get easy money. The fact that this game is still a thing is because the "modders" and fan base that keeps this trash alive, if an other dev. team would take the time to make a proper football manager simulation this game would die.

Enjoy your undeserved money you fucking scammers.

PEACE

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Great fun but a major time sink. If you're looking at this you probably already know what the series is about and you're wondering whether the version is better than others. 

I 'only' have 400 ish hours which as you know is still what I would call 'early journeyman save'. Barely dipped out of the lower leagues so far.

I noticed some problems how the match engine can't seem to cope with direct and high press, which leads to massive overachievement. But I only have one save and I haven't tried other circumstances. I will update this after I properly play including with the recent updates.

Comparing with the demos I've played from previous versions, this has major quality of life improvements, specifically scouting a player until complete report. Lots of other promising features and I can't think of another management/sim that could ever touch this. Recommended so far until I see how the big boys play.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Disgusting. Pathetic. Shameful. Developers should finally take a break for a year and try to do something similar to what the Football Manager should be - what it was before ... Unfortunately, the SI geniuses f*cked up everything that worked before and brought in "new", non-working sh*t.

1. Graphic engine? “It looks worse than some much older versions.”

2. New, more realistic animation? - A nightmare! Players, sometimes, make five turns on their own axis, before picking up the ball. Goalkeepers do not touch the ball if it hit the post. 

3. Crosses from the flanks - just fabulously good! 99 out of 100 will fall into the nearest defender!

4. Playing a short pass, tiki-taka, combinations - NOT IN THIS YEAR SON...

5. Referee ... They ... Like ... R*t*rds!!! 

6. Extremely terrible match view. When fixing offside, I must to believe the referee, because there is no replay. Dangerous shots to the goal, hitting the post - are no longer interesting, according to the developers, because there will be no replays, again. 

7. Mountains of unnecessary, useless, repetitive press. It has never been so boring.

8. New - non-working role for players.

9. New, useless, tactical presets.

10. New staff; System hierarchy in the team; Ugly, unnecessary 3D model of the coach; Creating your own club and much more.

P.S.  Football Manager 2020 may well become a game about zombie unicorns, if it continues like this...

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Events that took place:

Did not want to sell player,
Got an offer for said player,
Rejected the offer,
Player demaned to be allowed to speak to the club,
Got a second offer from said club,
Essentially forced to accept the offer,
Player reached an agreement with the club,
Wished player the "best of luck" in his future endeavours,
Player is angry that he is leaving,
Player considerers his new club a "step down" in his career,
Reminder: Player demanded to go to said club,
Me finding solice in the fact that FM19 although lacking in the football department, delivers a brilliant experience in dealings with manic and psychotic people.

Allow me to grant you an insight into SI's employee knowledge on the subject their games are about. I once engaged in a conversation with a developer at SI about FM, and football in general. After some talking about premier league, and me slightly confused, I eventually understood that this developer thought that Tottenham Hotspurs were located in Liverpool. So I posed him the following question: "Then why do they call any matches between Tottenham and Arsenal the 'North London Derby'?" to which he responded that he did not know, but he assured me that Tottenham F.C was located in Liverpool. I had to resort to showing him the borough of Tottenham in London for him to understand that Tottenham Hotspurs is not lovated in Liverpool, but in fact in London.

This will be the last edition of this game series I will ever purchase. In a football management simulator such as this, letting SI and their employees (including the one that responded to this review) tell you various aspects of football, is like having a pervert preach to you about the virtues of sexual absitence. They know nothing, and since the core game has not progressed the slightest in 10 years, it would be a fair assumption that they do not care neither.

Fuck SI, Fuck their beloved "devs" and fuck Charlton Heston while you're at it.
developer_response:
If you have the example of this in save game form, please raise the issue via our bugs forum and we'll investigate - https://community.sigames.com/forum/665-all-other-gameplay/

Whilst we try to make sure conversations are as logical as possible when attempting to replicate human emotions and their rationality, sometimes there will be occasions where incidents like the one you encountered occur. If we can get the save game examples we can break it down and figure out why in this happened in your specific save game.

Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Played FM for many years so I am not new to the series.  This year's version is OK but not as good as previous versions.  They made some good changes, expanded tactics, training, a few little UI things here and there and as always a massive database.  I usually get about 1000+ hrs in each version but in this one I'm only around 300.  
First off, I love the changes to training.  Creating schedules and adjusting them, while time consuming, adds an extra layer and almost takes me back to cm 03/04.  You can really target certain areas in the buildup before matches which I really enjoy.  Second, adding transition options and defensive width is quite helpful with tactics.  Allows for a lot of customization and tinkering with tactics.  
Finally, I think the game runs a bit smoother than previous years.  Or at least it does for me.  Not saying the animation is any better than previous years, I actually think 18 was better, but it seems to glide? along nicely.
After that, I don't have many good things to say about FM19.  
Press conferences, social feeds, team interaction, player interaction are all still brutal.  Press conferences are the same 5-10 questions that you always get asked with the same responses.  Social feeds are just a waste of time because they are the exact same formula, 1 good comment, 1 middling, and 1 negative.  It doesn't matter if they make sense or not, they are just always the same.  Really lazy SI!!!  Team interaction and player interaction are the same since the very beginning.  Same accusations and same retorts that never actually target what you want.  Team is dropping points in the last 10 minutes consistently, team meeting, isn't even an option to mention.  Player makes horrendous mistake that was so stupid it borders on comical and ends up with a 6.3 because of it.  After match conversation when you want to give him the hairdryer treatment, can't mention it.  But these have always been issues that SI has ignored so don't expect it to change anytime soon.  The same can be said for salary, contract conversations as well, and playing time.  It's always nice to have a guy come back from injury and take the hump because he isn't back in the first 11 immediately.
Transfers are also the usual headache.  AI teams will come in with a low ball bid and refuse to offer a realistic amount for your players.  You will identify a youth worth 500k and they will demand 55M pounds.  I found last year to be much better about this but it is really annoying and has been an ongoing problem in the series.
Finally, the actual match.....well.....the less said about that the better.  It is nowhere near as good as previous versions.  Players will not make space or create space for teammates.  In and around the box, just expect to hammer a ball into a defender.  Your guy will not dribble or try to create space.  The guys around him will not make runs or try to make space.  If it is knocked out to the wings, your guy will wait until he is closed down or he will dribble to the nearest defender he can find to hammer it off of his legs.  There are no through balls, lofted balls for strikers to run on to, or balls played low across the face of goal.  It just doesn't happen.  If a ball does flash across the goal, nobody will try for it.  Your striker will sit there and watch it roll by.  Defenders with space and time, the nearest opponent is getting a pie and tea, and they will head it straight to him, knocking his pie and spilling his tea.  Forget controlling it sensibly.  But if he does, whoa, watch out.  He will scream down the wing, surge into space, then, then, then, look for the nearest defender so he can smash the ball into his legs.  I've also found that strikers and wingers like to do the same.  If they are running onto a ball, the minute they get to it, they look to smash it straight at a defenders legs.  I've had strikers turn and run the other direction when they are involved in a two man counter.  The winger took off.  Loads of space for the striker to run into.  Only the two of them.  Then the striker saw a nice shiny 50p on the ground and decided to take off after that.  
I could go on about the decision making flaws that really take a lot of fun out of the game, and for me actually broke the game, but it's late and I've already rambled enough.  And this isn't an I can't win I wish it were easier point of view.  I've actually won the league 2 years in a row, reached the semis of the CL 2 years in a row, and won the FA and league cup twice each.  I'm at the top of the table again in my 3rd year.  I just don't like this years game.  I would really wait until next year and hope SI get their act together before purchasing this game.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I don't buy this franchise every year.. My last purchase was 2016, and I said I will give it a break for some time. So I bought 2019 version, expecting some marginal improvements and changes. Yet, honestly, other than the skins and colours, nothing much changes since 2014-2015. So called the biggest addition "training" setup in the game is nothing new in my opinion and the time you invest in doesn't worth the outcome so many experienced players are already giving that responsibility to assistant managers. The interviews etc. very limited and generic questions and answers. No fun - just waste of time in my opinion. I would like to see some more realistic feeling as to why I am winning one game 4-1 and loose it 1-5 next one in couple of days, with same teams. I would like to understand why a footballer with >17 long shots skill shoots all of them off target. More systematic and detailed approaches on improvement of player skills. More supportive data, and more cause > effect feeling. May be I am asking for too much but despite passing years it is nothing more than updated database with FM2016. May be less bugs.
It is not a bad game, so I still play it but I expect much more hence I say purchase cheaper options, since it doesn't make much difference.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
FM2019 is a great addition to the series, one of the better FMs in recent years however....

One word. Brexit. 

i am sure i seen people have problems with Brexit in FM2018, not being able to buy players that they want. issues with work permits Etc. On FM2019 i am in the year 2023, i have just moved to the english prem managing chelsea, i have plently of transfer money, however the game is like NOPE! you are not signing world class talent from outside the U.K. No matter who i try to buy. i know FM likes to simulate real life events, and no matter how much we complain to get Brexit removed it won't happen. It has just ruined the game for me, i don't deem it fun anymore. i like to bring in players from all over the world and it looks like that's almost impossible to do.

And for that i have to get this a negative review. i appreciate the devs making this wonderful series as true to real life as possible, but when they take it just that little bit too far it ruins the fun. it is a video game after all.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Ok another year another FM review.

Again after a quick browse of the reviews it appears the haters are brigading one of the greatest games ever made and arguably the best football simulator / tycoon game.

A lot of people cry about this game being scripted or random and I can assure you this has been a regular complaint and just comes down to people who don't understand the game and how it works.

I am able to take any team from any league and get them to the champions league. I have done consistently with Barnet, Coventry and Wrexham. I do not use any guides or shortlists and always play with random CA and PA if its available. My main critique has always been the game is far too easy when you understand how it works and I was hoping this would be addressed and in this game steps have definitely been made to address this.

This feels like a big improvement on last year so far with several upgraded and changes that have added to the realism. Here are some of them:

1) Tactics

Love the new tactics creator. Has all the same components as before but allows you to choose from more styles and breaks the tactic up into attack, defence and transition.

As a player who watches the games I really could see my decisions in action and found changing tactics led to visible changes on the pitch.

2) Training

Training feels a lot more hands on. I am yet to see the direct results long term but being able to completely tailor your training routines definitely adds more immersion to the game.

Feels a lot more realistic.

3) Scouting

Again not played enough to get the whole picture but it appears they have fixed OP scouting which has again made the game feel more realistic and increased difficulty.

I could literally scout 100 players and get all there reports in over the next week in old versions, it definitely feels like scouting is more realistic and report cards are staggered depending on your scouting team and network.

My friend says that top regens are also now a lot harder to buy, rather then being able to buy the next Messi for nothing from argentina these players come with a much higher cost or future costs associated with them.

4) Engine

I have noticed some improvements but never really had a major issue with the engine in the previous games personally.

I have noticed the back pass bug hasn't occurred yet. This is when your defender under no pressure passes back to the GK and just passes it out for a corner. Would happen a lot and is incredibly annoying and immersion breaking. 

I have only just started playing and am thoroughly enjoying FM2019 so far. Just feels like I have more control over things and feels more realistic so far.

Will update review as and when I notice improvements or critiques.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Played 5 versions over the last decade with many hours in each, and whilst I will play this one for a couple of hundred, it is by some distance the weakest one I've played. 

Primarily the match engine is embarrassing. A defender, with no other place within 20 yards, will head any ball in the air straight to the opposition for no reason. Goalkeepers will run the opposite direction to a back pass and concede an own goal. Strikers will get confused on a counter attack and jog instead of sprinting. The amount of times the opposition score with their only shot...

Outside of this expect to be spammed with the most pointless information about a 1 star players development to a 1.5 star player in your youth team coming straight to your inbox, meanwhile you have to hunt down information on the Champions League if you are not actively playing in it, even if you subscribe to it!

If you have played any version of the game from the past 10 years you will be familiar with all the press-conference questions and hand that, and many, many other duties over to your staff.

The most fun thing about previous games was signing players, shaping a team and seeing results with the formation you either developed or downloaded. I have developed and downloaded several so far and results are at best inconsistent and at worst comical.

The graphics are either a web browser or a Fallout 2 football mod. 90% of players don't have a photo.

The sounds only exist in matches, and the "ole" chants that fans do for passes when a team is winning by just 1-0 is ridiculous.

The concept of Football Manager is what keeps me coming back, but the reality drives me away quicker and quicker.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: This game is absolutely rubbish, tactically its is inept and after a long time playing it, it is clear that the game has a lot of issues with scripting, its feel as though the same things happen time and time again. The issue of scripting goes far beyond just the match engine and can easily be seen in the transfer market too. There is far too little instructions that you can give to your players, and sometimes these instructions appear to have little effect if any at all. The game gets so many things wrong it untrue, some players can't even play positions, that I know for a fact that they can play. The biggest example is Cesar Azpilicueta, who can only play at RB??? Despite being world class for two seasons at CB for Chelsea, they won the title the first season with him in that position. Its actually laughable; they don't put the effort into the graphics and instead put it into the database, that's all well and good but they can't even get that right. My advice would be don't waste your time or money on a game that isn't much different or better to the 2018 game, which has the same issues. Quite simply a lack of development here. We will change the colour of the background add a few little feature and give them sophisticated names to fool people into thinking we have made ground-breaking changes. This game series has had issues with scripting for 2 decades, it feel like its not testing my football knowledge but instead my knowledge of how to bet the match engine, that not football. Perhaps they should call it Match Engine Manager 2019. Don't waste your money! This really is a poor excuse for a football management game, safe to say I will never buy another game from this shambles of a game series. Same old, same old issues and I can't see them ever being rectified, as the game maker are clearly incompetent, lazy and lack football knowledge. Rating players out of 20 is such a rubbish concept and does not even begin to account for the varying degrees of ability in football, not that this really matters because they mess up the player ratings anyway. After considerable time playing it i have un-installed it and shall happily go back to playing FIFA 19 they do not have it perfect either but at least their match engine understands football. Look Foward to the day sport interactive go into administration you money grabbers.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Like many have said about Football Manager 2019, its not really any big improvement on the previous titles. If you look at my Game Library, you can see that i tend to skip 1 or 2 versions of this game at a time, purely because they dont really add/change fix the game enough over the course of 2 versions to warrant a full price buy.
The game itself is ok, lots of cool stuff from the community but the game mechanics are the same and are as broken as the previous titles.
Watching the games are incredibly tilting as whatever you seem to do, no matter how much better your side is, will simply be a rng away from giant killing. The Instant Result seems to negate some of this RNG  thats added to some of the public skins that have been made, but that limits you to actually watching the game after you know the result and you lose a lot of that Football Manager feeling on the touchline.

The graphics for the games hasnt changed at all, its still a simplified mess and has 0 detail as ever version fo the game has had since they added it.
The hierarchy system just adds another aspect to juggle which is ok, but seems very one dimensional. 
Overall, the game is ok, but I could have easily just continued with FM17/16, whichever one i previously had, because it simply hasnt changed enough, none of the areas have been fixed, they simply update the squads and roll it out for another £30, they seriously need a overhaul of this game and take it in a different direction, its getting extremely stale which is a huge shame.
I think I have more satisfaction whirling up my ps1 and playing Premier League Football Manager 2000, cause everything thats added into the game has a great polish and feels like it should be in the game.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I played for 140 hours in this game. I could win three "Champions League" cups with "Tottenham", I won "Premier-League" for six times, and one "FA CUP". 

So, the game became easier than "Football Manager 2018". For instance, you can win some cup of Europe in the beginning of your career, and I did with "Tottenham". And maybe two or three seasons later you can win "Champions League" with "Cheltenham" or with some weak team. 

Also I noticed scripts here. If you change all the skills of some player for 20, of course, this player will be playing good, but if you do it with defender, they won't be able to do anything with a simple forward. I remember when my team was playing against "Brighton", "Tottenham" missed two goals. 

I have questions to the 3D matches. Why forwards run all the pitch and all defenders then they score. You won't see it in the real football. And why you cannot do the 3D matches better? Look at "FIFA MANAGER 2013". 

Now I am glad that your results depend on a picked tactic. "Sports Interactive" added more opportunities for creating a tactic. And it's cool, even the 18th part had no so many styles.

Before I started writing this review I had noticed players get injuries so often. Remember when I could rent a player Carles Alena from "Barcelona", one match later he got an injury for 4 months, after that I was so sad...

However, almost nothing is changed by comparing with the 18th part, and it fills me with sorrow, as "Sports Interactive" changes nothing year after year. 

I would not buy this game if knew what is inside of it.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
---PROBLEM FIXED---

I've enjoyed this series since fm 2016, and had no problem running it smoothly.
This one however, seems to be not using the actual GPU i have, (1050 ti on asus gaming laptop) and using the intel intergrated graphics. When I go in to the settings menu, the game says my computer's 3D graphic performance is 1 star, when I had 5 stars on fm 2018 with the same exact laptop. When I play the game, it is really laggy (FPS wise), and has slow response time. I hope I could enjoy this game, but with this issue it is impossible. 
Is there anyway to fix this problem?
developer_response:
Okay first up make sure the game is set to run the right GPU by following the instructions here - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2019/180_how-to/181_pc/how-to-switch-between-dedicated-and-integrated-graphics-cards-r628/

Once you've done so, we'd recommend deleting your cache and preferences folders so that the game re-reads the GPU settings the next time the game launches. Details on how to do this here - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2019/180_how-to/181_pc/how-to-delete-my-preferences-andor-caches-folder-r615/

If you still find you're having issues with performance after doing this, we'd suggest reading this - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2019/183_technical-support/186_pc/the-game-appears-slow-when-i%E2%80%99m-clicking-between-screens-r691/

Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Firstly, 9/10

After an okay amount of hours on this game I'd say this is the best version of FM i've ever played. It's fun, realistic, editable and challenging (not so much after a while but yeah). However, this review is for Sports Interactive more than it is to the customers.

The first MAJOR problem is that the online modes are absolutely useless, I've tried unreal internet connection speeds and the game is still super laggy, and as far as I know, everyone's facing the same problem. It's 2019 is it REALLY THAT HARD to have dedicated online servers? who still makes their customers host servers?? I swear if the game cost 100$ but had dedicated online servers i would definetly still buy it.

Another problem is the finance being not realistic, as I knew from some reasearch, if a team with low income is promoted to a high division ( for example; Championship, Premier League) it is given a bulk amount of money to match a point of being the lowest possible yet efficient level of finance for its league. How am I supposed to be in the premier league and have like 6k max wages p/w? also needs more work.

I really hope this reaches sports interactive because it will definetly make the game better if they act on these issues.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I honestly don't understand how this game can be so expensive, especially considering next to nothing has been changed from previous versions. Whilst at times it might be fun, the scripting is unreal and spoils any realism. It isn't user friendly. It's overly restrictive in some area's whilst overly detailed in others. To top it off, it has a truly cancerous community and dev team that don't seem to want to make any fixes or changes to the game.

The match engine is completely broken. If you are going to have 3D view and animation, at least make enough varients that it isn't repetetive. Make idiotic things like 40 yard own goals almost impossible to happen (has happened twice in two different cup finals for me, the odds of that ever happening irl are minute). Tactics make no difference. None. Results seem pre determined before the game has started. Players seem to do the opposite of what you ask. Some games reloading and changing things yields different results, but in most it takes at least 20 games, if not more before you ever get any sort of result. It took me fourty games - yes, FOURTY - to score a single goal in one tie, despite me having comfortably beaten the very same team 2-0 just a week before. One on Ones are broken. 90% of the time they will miss or hit it straight at the keeper. The amount of shots, especially long range ones that are clearly saved by the keepers and magically, every time, clip the crossbar are given as goalkicks instead of corners. Kick off goals are insanely common. Strikers are broken, as is crossing the ball. Your wingers will get 20 goals a season whilst your striker struggles to get 10. Corners and freekicks are the main way to score, and even the worst players deliver a world class free kick 80% of the time. You can never win an appeal for a red card, injuries are far too common.

Too much is wrong. Not worth buying if you have an older version of the game.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:

just fix the lag, I don't care about anything else by this point...
developer_response:
We've rolled a fix out for Lag on Macs via our public beta. Details on how to gain access here - https://community.sigames.com/topic/465780-performancelag-problems-on-mac-post-1922/

Thanks.

developer_response:
It's working fine here for us and no other user has raised this issue. We'd recommend checking first of all via the Staff -> Staff Responsibilities -> First Team that you're set to 'Handle Press Conferences' via the dropdown. 

If you are set to manage them and are still having these issues, if you trying to run a custom skin or any custom graphics etc, that it would be worth removing them and seeing if that helps.

If that still doesn't fix your issue, please try deleting your cache and preferences folders as shown via our FAQ link here - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2019/180_how-to/181_pc/how-to-delete-my-preferences-andor-caches-folder-r615/

title: Football Manager 2019
review: his game beta includes some very good assets, with the traditional UI included from all football manager games football manager games. However there are a few minor issues that could be ironed out. For example, some players decide that they are unhappy with the management of the club even when the team's morlale is high, and far too many players hand in transfer requests. Another issue is the camera angles that have been included in this beta. Only a few options available work, however very little changes are made when swapping between each of them. Overall, this beta seems to have been a success ahead of the full game launch, as this new addition within the FM franchise feels like it has the potential to be the best one yet.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
So this is my first Football Manager and I can safely say after 400 hours of play that is this not a good game overall. I can't speak for other entries in the series but this game's modeling of real life is absurd in the extreme, both on and off the field. Players get upset when you complement them. They whine that they want to go to a better team then get upset when you try to transfer them. Players are made of paper, they get injured way way too much. I've had players go out for 2 months during a match preview session. Red cards are handed out for nothing and egregious fouls are ignored. Teams you should be crushing blow you away and teams you should get crushed by don't even show up. 

The general impression I get from this game is it's all random. All the player interactions, the stats, the tactics and strategies all mean exactly nothing. You might as well be playing Blood Bowl rolling dice. At least in that game there's no match engine pretending to simulate a result - you know it's all RNG.

I've read that the Football Manager series is one that takes a while to cook. That after 6 months of tweaks and patches the game starts to improve. If that's the case we're not there yet. If you really really want a management game I'd suggest looking elsewhere for now, or maybe even to older versions of the FM series that have their engines fixed already, because right now, FM 19 is just an exercise in random number frustration. There are better RNG heavy games out there.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: THIS IS THE WORST FOOTBALL MANAGER TO DATE, THEY PUT SO MANY NEW THINGS IN BUT NOTHING THAT EFFECTS THE GAMEPLAY. I WISH I NEVER PURCHASED, THE PLAYERS HAVE TRAITS THAT THEY DONT HAVE IN REAL LIFE. THEIR NATURAL POSITIONS ARE DIFFERENT FROM REAL LIFE. IN ANY GIVEN MATCH THE CPU CAN ATTEMPT ONLY 1 SHOT AND YOU WILL STILL DRAW THE MATCH REGARDLESS OF YOUR TEAM SELECTION, TACTICS, YOUR ATTEMPTS ON GOAL IT DOES NOT MATTER. THIS GAME IS TRASH, THERE IS NOTHING TO LIKE, FM 18 WAS 100X BETTER. I HAVE PURCHASED EVERY FOOTBALL MANAGER DATING BACK TO 2006/2007, THIS WILL BE MY LAST ONE. I REFUSE TO PAY FOR ANOTHER ONE AFTER PLAYING THIS, I AM SO ASHAMED THAT I EVEN SPENT MONEY ON THIS ONE. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME, IT IS NOT WORTH 1 PENCE. title: Football Manager 2019
review: Football manager gets worse every year, they focus on the things that do not matter too much and not enouigh attention to what really matters. WHAT GOES ON THE FOOTBALL PITCH. It is all based on irrelevant variables such as team talks and shouts having too much effect on the outcome of how players play. The PPM do not match the full natural role that players play for example a footballer that is right footed plays left mid yet they tell you his best position is a WINGER and his PPM is cut inside, HOW DOES THIS MAKE SENSE. With regards to tactics for example you have work the ball in box assigned and you have ozil who LOOKS TO PASS BEFORE SCORING, shooting outside the box numerous times even though you got him playing in an advanced playmaker role in cam position with support duty and the instructions automatically assigned to this role is SHOOT LESS OFTEN. HOW DOES THIS MAKE SENSE. They need to bring back sliders, they need to work on tactics. THEY NEED TO WORK ON EVERYTHING AND REVAMP THE WHOLE GAME INSTEAD OF FOCUSIN ON IRRELEVANT THINGS. True football manager players realise this game is going downhill RAPIDLY. This is only a short paragraph of what i can delve into at this time as I do not want to give Sports Interactive any more of my time. I am disgusted i got roped in to buy FM again after being disappointed for several years. This truly was the best football simulation and they have ruined my game. I JUST WANT MY GAME BACK!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I've played football management games since the days when they came on cassette tapes.  I've played this franchise since Championship Manager 97-98, and I've played every version intensively.  

Football Manager 2019 is the worst version of the game ever.  There are many reasons for this.  

Firstly, the match engine is terrible, and has been the subject of countless bug reports and complaints on Sports Interactive's Football Manager forums.  One particular annoyance has been the problem of getting players to cross the ball; they will seemingly do anything but.  But it would be wrong to focus on my 'favourite' bug in the game, as there are so many problems with the match engine, and other areas of the game, which explains why, at the time of writing this review, there are more than 20,000 posts on the bugs forum. 

One of the big claims to improvement by SI for this game was the revamped training system.  However, it is shambolic.  The sheer volume of choices, which should be a good thing, becomes an issue when the decisions you make either have no effect, or trigger immediate problems. 

The AI controlling player personalities, driving interactions with players, is simply broken.  One of my favourite examples is a player who was a few months into a five-year contract.  I was given a heads-up that he was unhappy, because he wanted a new contract.  He hadn't asked for a new contract, much less been refused, but was unhappy anyway.  I opened a private chat with him, but the chat was over immediately because his reaction was that he was so pleased I'd come to talk to him, he didn't want a new contract any more.  There are many threads on the forums devoted to the nonsensical and plain silly player interactions, which really mar the game.

Press conferences are the most tedious, pointless aspect of the game.  There is an option for allowing the AM to handle them, but it doesn't matter how good your AM is, he will make a mess of press conferences. 

The much-vaunted dynamics on the game are equally ridiculous, with players showing unhappiness on one screen appearing to be entirely happy on another. 

As a tactics buff, I expected great things when I first saw the new tactics screens on FM19.  However, for all the choices you have, you might as well not bother, because the don't seem to affect matches in the slightest.  It's not just the crossing problem.  Pressing, possession play, marking... it's simply broken.  On a tactic I used, I had instruction for two of my players to man mark specific positions on the opposition teams.  I played many, many matches, and never saw my players make a single attempt to mark those positions; in fact, the opposite seemed to be true, with the opposition players being given huge amounts of time and space. 

The daftness of the game permeates every single element.  After I played a Community Shield match, I got an inbox message stating that my keeper had set a new Community Shield record by keeping one clean sheet, as the previous record had been zero clean sheets.  I paid good money for this game. 

I am not alone in being infuriated by paying for a game which is simply not ready.  Unfortunately, there are limited opportunities to make complaints.  The obvious option in to use the Sports Interactive forums.  However, the level of dissatisfaction over the game being raised on the forums seems to have triggered a policy of moderators silencing complaints, and banning forum users who show any dissent against the full on barrage of positive propaganda being spouted by moderators and developers.  It suggests SI know they got this game badly wrong.  

Personally, I'm so infuriated with the way SI have milked the fans with this poor iteration of the game, which has compounded the problems that surfaced with FM18, after the brilliant FM17, that I will not buy any further iterations.  One bad game is a blip, but two consecutive bug-ridden games, compounded by SI's apparent policy of silencing unhappy paying customers has made me completely lose faith in the company.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I highly recommend this for anyone looker for a more complex football management game. Contrary to most reviews, the game for me is quite addiciting. It impossible to play the game for less than a couple of hours. I have yet to try a LLM (Lower League Management) save. However, I have found the game to still be interesting. I would recommened watching FoxInTheBoxFM or Bustthenet on YouTube for tips.

Things I Enjoy:
-The excitement of matches. Will i destroy the mid-table side with my title contending team or be upset? IDK but it sure is fun to find out. 
-When I find the wonderkid talent no one has found yet in my save and that i had no knowledge of? Yes, Thiago Almada. Will i find more? Hopefully
-The in-depth tactics, contracts, and other management things.
-finding players and tactics that work well.

Things I dislike and hope improve:
-Shots on targets to goal ratio. SOMETIMES, the opposing keeper is having the game of their life, which is normal. BUT, i feel like it happens too often. 
-one on one conversion rate. sometimes it is reasonable for a player to miss a couple, but I feel like it happens too often for quality strikers.
-press conferences have a small variety of topics to discuss. most being reasonable, but after a while the same questions appear. This being my fault for playing the game for a long duration of time, but there has to be a larger variety.

Description: Addicting
Rating: 9.25/10

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I really wanted to recommend this game but after many hours of play it seems like the same old crap is happening all over again with press conferences. They are exactly the same, it gets very repetitive very quickly, you get asked the same questions over and over and over and over again with the same 5 answers everytime, why not add any sort of variation, surely in 2018 you had the computing ability to make the press conferences more indepth, it angers me year after year seeing this, improve other things but leave the press conferences

Although I do enjoy the game and have played it quite a bit, there are some little flaws, like when my preseason ended mid July and the season started at the end of July, then we had a mid season break from mid November to late December with all teams playing friendlies, another one was when the penalties were taken 2 each at a time - all in all not a bad game, if it weren't for the press conferences I'd be saying 8.5/10 and recommended, but with the press conferences being the way they are it's a 6/10 and not recommended

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Problems with match engine everyone is talking about can be summed up by this:

Post match stats
Man U - 34 Shots, 12 On Target, 52% Posession, 75% Pass completion, 93% Tackles won. 
Spartak Moscow - 9 Shots, 2 on Target, 48% Posession, 65% Pass completion, 84% Tackles won.

Here's how it played out: First half we destroy them. Shot after shot after shot. They cant get near our goal. We take every ball off them. Half time? We've been unlucky. Second half starts. They score 47th minute. 

That's ok though, because we are destroying them, we are basically just sat in their box firing shot after shot, header after header, corner after corner. There's nothing to change.

Minute 70 rolls around. I'm powerless. It's one way traffic and we are peppering them with shots. 

Minute 80 rolls around. What do I change? Do I want to? We are peppering them with shots. Their goalkeeper has got PTSD by this point. He's a nervous wreck. 

Minute 84. We score. Phew. Minute 86. We score. Phew. And we win.

But this is not an irregular occurance. And this is a good moment in a sea of bad. 

You see, sure, I won on this occasion, but there has been many occasion like this where I am sieging them, the shots are on target, the corners are greeted with one of my players headers, they can't even get past the half way line, but I still lose.

And it's that feeling of powerlessness, that despite everything in the game telling you that it is one way traffic, that *IT'S JUST A MATTER OF TIME*, and then it isn't, and they counter attack once and win. 

That's what you see everyone talking about. FM is a puzzle game at heart, but it's a puzzle game where it tells you that you are doing everything correctly, but gives you one thing when you know you should be getting the other. 

The match engine has something fundamentally wrong with it. Loads of people seem to be able to master it after a while, but then it arbitrarily keeps you from winning. It's like they know they messed it up and made it too easy, and so made your ability to score harder than it should be. 

The depth of this game is astonishing, and creating your way of playing football is fantastic, but something is rotten in the state of Football Manager, and it cannot be ignored.

Edit: Since writing this review, I played another game. Man UTD at home. 
Stats-
Man UTD - 34 Shots, 20 on Target
Southampton - 10 shots, 2 on Target
Score - 0-0 draw.

Lukaku alone had a player rating of 8.2, with 10 key headers, but still couldn't score. When your striker has a rating of 8.2 and you have 20 shots on target, your tactics are working. This game is broken.

developer_response:
Sorry to hear you're encountering this issue with the game.

As a starting point we'd suggest uninstalling and reinstalling your graphics card drivers as shown here - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2019/180_how-to/181_pc/how-to-update-my-graphics-card-drivers-r625/

If you still find you're having issues, try going into the in-game preferences and switching from Full Screen to Windowed mode and see if the same issue occurs. 

If after both of the above you still have issues, please contact help@sega.co.uk for additional support. Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
After playing more than a bit of 19.2 aka the ' first major update' I'm ready to write my review. Unfortunately it's very negative, due to one of the most boring and flawed ME in recent years. The biggest issue is always strikers movement, it's just not there and there's really no difference between DLF on support or AF. Lack of strikers movement obviously has a negative impact on central play and especially playmaker types, as most chances will come from set pieces (corner kicks, free kicks and attacking throw in), long shots (quite effective on this update) and the old far post crosses. Other old issues in other areas (AI squad building, tranfers logic, terrible regen faces/hair) as well as new promising additions (more tactical options, revamped training) become less important when ME is in such state. I want to be optimistic though, the new live beta experiment might prove to be a very good thing for the development of ME if SI is smart enough to listen to the right people. Right now I'm afraid they haven't.

If you're willing to pay 50 euros for an excellent football database and impress your friends with your knowledge of obsucre wonderkids from the most exotic countries, then this game is for you. Otherwise, not recommended.

Lot of original clubs are missing logos and other details believe due to frnchise issues.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: Since game sponsors are Germans and Italians, its impossible to play against teams from their divisions. Money wasted.
developer_response:
Any sponsorship or licences have no bearing on the quality of the teams in game. We pride ourselves on having what we feel is the most accurate football databases in the world and this is based on thousands of scouts compiling information on players and leagues. 

Any difficulty against teams of this nation are likely due to slightly different tactical styles. As we've seen this year in major European competitions, English clubs have struggled against teams with different styles - losing against Serbia and French clubs amongst others. This is something which also needs to be taken into account in-game whereby the user has to realise that tactics need to be considered for every match.

Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
UPDATE
Thank you dev for good and quick response! You made my day and my "cons" are solved.

I really love this game. Actually, it is pretty good football manager with big BUT:
Boards expectations are totally unrealistic. I can give you small example. I won playoff place in league by a short head and I managed to move up - next season board expectations in much more stronger league were playoff place. This is totally unrealistic. It's killing player opportunity to develop your club slowly, see your yongster career and so on.
Basically, it's impossible to stay in some lower league and enyoy small clubs football because you will get SACKED! And after new club, you will get SACKED also after about 2 seasons (traditionally sooner).
Good game, it is good game but do not spend your money, if you like lower leage football, slow club and players development and all, what makes football so fantastic. I played this game a lot, every time starting over and over but I'm done. If there is no official nosacking dlc (touch do not intrested me), patch, option, whatsoever - I do not recommend it. This is the game, provide us nosacking option and I will love this game.
developer_response:
It's dependent on the team - some clubs will have much higher expectations depending on who's running the club. Happens all the time in real life, Jokanovic or Darrell Clarke at Bristol Rovers. The latter had two promotions in a row then was sacked a couple of years later. 

From a game perspective there is an option to have the user be unsackable in full FM via the in-game editor.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: https://imgur.com/a/RCSXG4k Here is my team playing with Galatasaray 3 season and i am Champions league champion but problem is when i wanna try legend transfers still they are saying galatasaray is little club they dont wanna come because of champions league and so on. I am already champion how the heck can it be possible. Second problem galatasaray has debts yes understood but i made 125m $ income to club but they didint give me one cent in transfer budget, management is controling budget i tried every way every setting its not happening
developer_response:
There's a couple of factors at play here. Even as Champions League winners, teams based in Turkey are generally going to be seen smaller than those from the 'big leagues' across Europe as the reputation of the league is lower. Until Turkish clubs are consistently winning European competitions, players will more likely look to move to Spain, England and Germany. 

In regards to your spending budget, this is specific to the club. Essentially due to breaking FFP the club had to make a deal with UEFA where they aren't allowed to spend any more money on transfers per season than the earn. More details below:

Entered into a new settlement agreement with UEFA covering the 2018/19, 2019/20, 2020/21 and 2021/22 seasons for failing to adhere to FFP rules.  As a result, they have the following restrictions imposed on them by UEFA

- Must maintain a maximum wage bill of 60% of Revenues (including bonuses and signing on fees/loyalty bonuses)
- Must maintain a positive transfer balance (player sales must be >= player purchases) each season throughout the agreement
- Must report losses of no more than:
20 million Euro in 2018/19
10 million Euro in 2019/20
Break even in 2020/21 and 2021/22 seasons

- Club may register players for European competitions as follows:
21 players for the 2018/19 season.  Of these 21 players, 4 must be home grown, 1 must be club grown.
22 players for the 2019/20 season.  Of these 22 players, 4 must be home grown, 2 must be club grown.
23 players for the 2020/21 season.  Of these 23 players, 4 must be home grown, 3 must be club grown.
25 players for the 2021/22 season.  Of these 25 players, 4 must be home grown, 4 must be club grown.

- Club are to pay 2 million Euro fines in 2018/19, 2019/20 and 2020/21 seasons.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Used to play FM long time ago (Championship Manager 3), I've tried the 2016 edition without being hooked.
I've bought this 2019 edition seeing a lot of good reviews.

I find this edition super deep, while being "easy" to start with, because of how clear it is to let your assistants handle different parts of the game (recrutement, training, young-squad etc).
So you can start focussing on your team + tactics + buy 1-2 players. 4 months after that, look into training to customize a bit more your team and so on.

I had a good time playing with Guingamp (France) for my first season, finishing 4th (I've cheated a bit :p)
I'm going to start a new game without cheating, now that I know how the game works.

I don't regret my full price pickup day 1!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
So I like the overall state of the game, and they did improve training to feel more personalized. 

However, i just can't reccomend it. The match engine is absolutely terrible, and the in game instructions do not work at all. As other reviews on here have said: 

You: Real Madrid. Over 70% of possession, 20+ shots with maybe 5 on target with misses on an open net. You don't score at all. 

Opponent(CPU): Shenhua(Chinese Super League). 30% of possession,  6 shots with 4 on target. Beat you 3-0.

You are paying for a product that is completely unrealistic. I hear that the beta version was better. You can have the best team in the game, but you'll lose to everybody. In the matches I won, the scores were 7-5, 3-2, 1-0, 8-6. 

These are the norm. I have played with teams in Chinese Leagues, MLS, and La Liga. 

I want to love this series. I want it to be good. I GET thate there needs to be parity, where anyone can beat anyone. I just need the match engine to actually work. THAT'S IT.

Until then, there is no way I can reccomend this.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I've been an FM fan since the release of FM 2011. I have played almost every version of the game since then, including the mobile apps. 

I can safely say that FM 2019 is the best version of the game yet. With the new training and tactics systems the game is way more fun to play. I am a Barca fan, and while I have been able to recreate Barca's play-style in earlier versions of the game, it has never been more accurate than in this one. And the best part is that it's really easy to do (Much less fiddling around in menus). The new UI and Game engine upgrades are also worth mentioning as pros. 

The only real con I can think of is that now the game feels a bit easier. While this may be more applealing to casual players and newcomers to the franchise, it reduces the enjoyment for experienced players. I finished my last season winning the treble and all the pre-season trophies without losing a single match in the league (while some of those have been done in real life, it's extremely rare and shouldn't be this easy to attain). The SI team should probably try and address this somehow. Maybe make it harder to get your players to follow your tactics? Create dressing room tension based on your tactical choices? Create some top-level drama from the board regarding your tactics, forcing you to make changes? Something to make the game more dynamic and challenging, please.

It's a great entry into the series that adds a lot of much needed improvements for hardcore fans such as myself, and it's also (in my opinion) the most approachable edition for potential newcomers to the FM community. Definitely worth a purchase if you haven't upgraded in a while or if you're a football fan who has never played FM.

My rating - 9/10

P.S., If you bought FM 18, I won't recommend the upgrade to FM 19 (Although if you do choose to upgrade, you won't hate yourself for it).

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I've played football management games ever since Champ manager 93 on the amiga but after playing this one i think i'm done with this franchise. 

You get to create the look of your manager during the game setup stage but this is absolutely pointless as you never get to actually see him in game, only when you select your save game. This isn't a bad thing though as the manager model looks like a 4 yr old has drawn it. A complete waste of time and effort adding this to the game. The game doesn't seem to have proper logos anymore. You can download these in logo packs from various sites but would've been nice to have them in the game. player faces only seem to show up on players i've signed and still some don't show up at all.

Speaking of pointless features, the social media screen serves no point at all apart from simply adding another screen to have to click past in order to progress the game. Playing as Arsenal i always got around 600 people liking a decision, roughly the same number against the decision and the same number didn't care either way. 

The training revamp means you can't target a certain stat like crossing or defending to improve on a certain player you have to train it as a team. The devs say this is more realistic but other aspects of the game are so unrealistic it's laughable! I ended up leaving training to my assistant as the slightest tweak seemed to lead to an handful of injuries. I personally prefer the old training from fm 12.

Scouting seems to only find a few well known players despite paying for the top tier scouting and employing a full roster of scouts and personally assigning them to different regions, nations and leagues from around the world. When you do find a player the selling club will demend a huge fee. If they don't want to sell no amount will change their mind. For example i bid 300k for a 16 yr old kid valued at 130k, the club rejected so i kept incresing my bids just to see what would be acceptable. I reached 80 million before i stopped. Completely unrealistic.

Finally the match engine is the worst i have ever seen on a fm game. Completely broken! I have had numerous games where i've had 30+ shots with 12+ on target and maybe scored 1 or 2 goals, with 3 world class strikers. The opposition has 3 shots 3 on target and scores 3. I've tried playing defensive using various formations/tactics but it doesn't really seem to make a difference. It feels like the game has already decided a scoreline before the game even starts. Shouts and team talks seem irrelevant. Goalkeeper runs past defenders for no reason and the opposite team shoot from their own half and score. My CB skin kept changing to show him as a keeper and the keeper appeared as a outfield player. It kept saying my keeper was joining the attack when he wasn't. If you try playing an high offside line the defenders just stop and and allow the opposition players to score. Play a deep line and they refuse to mark and get consistently out jumped. strikers refuse to square the ball to an unmarked teammate, instead they'll try and shoot from an acute angle. I could go on about lots of other issues but just search various forums and you'll find the same topics recurring. 

In conclusion i feel this is the worst FM i have played. The demo felt like a more polished version of the full game. Maybe they'll fix the bugs in march or something but it's already too late for me. I didn't pay £37 to beta test a game. Sure, every game has bugs but fm19 has far too many.  Bugs that should've been flagged and fixed before release. A shame but it seems like Sports interactive have got too comfortable with lack of competition out there for a good alternative football manager game

I mean the number of times my players have hit the woodwork is just absurb.
