title: Football Manager 2019
review:
anyone else find the game far too easy???

First season with liverpool on previous editions i usually find myself in a battle for 4th (yes i am aware liverpool have a very good squad compared to 3 years ago)  however on this one i have won the league with 95 points a mere 20 points above Man U in second with 75 (City finished 4th with pep being sacked ater 12 games) not only this i also won the FA Cup and the Champions League which inlcuded a 5-0 win over real madrid, 4-1 win over Napoli and a 5-2 win over spurs in the final.

Also players demanding ridiculous contracts seems to be a thing?

Despite Alisson being a new signing in the summer he demanded in december that I doubled his wages and even funnier than that Joe Gomez demanded he went from 20k odd a week to 160k and trent from 40k a week to 250k a week a long with a number of other players wanting new contracts and when i decline these hilarious demands they all want to leave and it drives morale down but i still when everygame anyway

Seems to be an insane amount of injuries as well 

Finally Man Utd seemed to be desperate to sign every striker in the game adding Icardi Kane and Morata to their ranks and being linked to others despite playing one striker 

Ive been an FM lover on both handheld and pc since 08 but i didnt buy 18 and depised 17 thought I would give this one a go but I am still convinced they havent made a good balanced version since 16

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Football manager 2019 is a much improved game compared to its older versions, especially its improvement in the training department, however it has its share of issues or they might be BUGS that needs to be fixed and fixed fast, for example 
- During a contract negotiation of new transfer the agent requests a wage which is conviniently agreed upon, however for a mere yearly wage rise of 10% if we negotiate it for 5% the agent cancels the deal. 
- Another issue is a penalty taker is changed during a penalty but it does not change in that vary penalty, then whats the point of changing him. 
- The most irritating of all & probably the most common amongst all the gamers is, none of my players are crossing the ball, playing with 2 full back and 2 inside forwards, instructed to cross more often and overlap runs, still no crosses at all instead they pass it backwards, played a whole season with that issue, this needs to be fixed, coz this really seem to be a BUG to me, its really frustrating playing the Wing Play mode and no one is crossing the ball, as a player of this game for many years i suggest to rectify it soon, or else expect to loose clients.

review:
So I only got into Football Manager earlier this year playing FM18.

Don't ask where ive been the past few years, cause  my answer is "Planted firmly on my ass playing FIFA"
Anyway, after really enjoying FM18 I boarded the hype train for FM19,  and I must say I am really eenjoying it.

If it is possible to edit reviews i will edit this and do a more  in depth review when I am not verging on passing out.

In Short, Highly reccomend 10/10

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Seasonal improvement on the annual update of a great game or another step futher into the ever complex world of micro management of a football club? It's a case of being a bit of both I'm afraid.
While there is no doubt that the game has been tweaked to make the everyday realism mirror the real football world with improved match graphics and the introductions of features such as VAR, there is also a lot more detail to digest before, during and after each game which can make it a real full time job to ensure you take it all on board.
So while the immersion to the management world is undoubtadly immense these further tweaks may turn the casual gamer away, but for me it's time to once again trawl those lower league for a cheap sigining who may transform my mediocre season, as I try and drag a club from the depths to football to the upper tiers of global success.

Game is getting better and better with each year, but there's a thing that's bothering me in this particular version.
I know that the developers wanted to make set-pieces great, only... They made it worse. AI is using it in their advantage for the most part. And, when it comes to Route One... It's OP for the AI... You can have best def in the game, yet AI will score without a problem... Physics really need to be reworked on my oppinion, and when it does, i bet the game will have even more people playing it, and enjoying it. title: Football Manager 2019
review:
This is probably the best iteration of Football Manager in a while. If you are the kind of person that only buys FM every 2-4 years, this is the one you have been waiting for.

The last couple of years have seen lots of changes that did not really seem to change the way the game was played. New staff roles, scouting changes - all of it seemingly just in the way. This year they have fleshed a lot of these features out more, and they feel more substantial than when they were introduced.

FM19 is not content with merely tying up loose ends from previous editions! It introduces completely new modules for tactics and training. These are brilliant. Especially the training module, which moves the entire FM experience more towards realism and makes it much more transparent in terms of understanding how it impacts individuals and the team. It is a bit overwhelming, though. Fortunately, an assistant manager can competently lead training for you.

The shake-up in the tactics module also attempts to make this component more legible and logical. It has come a long way since the sliders of yesteryear. Now we can control how our team reacts on and off the ball with much more granularity, which should help players who have not played the game for 1.000 hours already. It also offers a bunch of premade tactical systems that playes can choose as a starting point for their team. They do not guarantee success, but they are a great way to begin.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Game is currently in beta conditions. Its playable but filled with game breaking bugs.

There is a bug that can prevent you from saving. I lost eight hours of gameplay.  Another big bug I ran into was being unable to increase the clubs youth level which made trying to develop youth players much harder.

The worst is the Football Manager Community on the SI Forums. They are almost like a cult. Filled with fanboi's and heavy handed moderators.

They relentless attack those who bring up any shortcoming of SI and are quick to defend them. You will attacked by the community and have any threads that point anything wrong being closed.

Members of the community were attacking people for leaving negative feedback in the official feedback thread.
developer_response:
In regards to saving, have you tried reading and following the instructions related to this via our FAQ? - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2019/183_technical-support/186_pc/unable-to-save-the-game-successfullycrashes-whilst-saving-r672/

If you try the above and still find you're having issues, please create a support ticket at the following URL and someone will try to help - https://support.sega.co.uk/hc/en-gb/requests/new

In regards to our community forum, people are absolutely inclined to raise their own opinions in regard to the game whether they're positive or negative. All we ask is that people try and keep criticism constructive to enable us as developers to see the reason why the user has negative opinions and give us an avenue to try and improve the game. If you feel a user has been attacked for any reason on our forum, please do take the time to report the post in question via our reporting tools and this can be investigated further. 

Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Seriously, do not buy this game. To preface, I had so much fun with it during the beta, everything was relatively perfect (bar some minor bugs with interactions, but given the complexities and frequency of interactions thats acceptable to me).

And of course, patch 19.1 comes out and the game turns to literal shit. It is now impossible to score goals using strikers, or by creating chances from open play in general. Strikers miss sitters, corners are more likely to score than one on ones, defending is out of your control as your players will all swarm the ball no matter what you tell them to do, and goalkeepers are way too overpowered (will literally save every one on one or shot in the box).

Honestly a shame, because everything not gameplay related is great and the training changes are excellent, but there is literally no use to having better training if when my players become world class strikers, they cannot score and instead go on 15 hour goal droughts.

Before anyone says I havent tried different tactics, trust me I have - I've tried everything, 3 at the back, 4 at the back, 5 at the back, defensive mids, pressing, tiki taka, etc and none of it fixes anything. Just get a 6'7" cb and youll win games from corners, but thats not a fun or rewarding way to play. For reference, I got promoted to the prem and won the FA cup in my first season as blackburn, but ever since halfway thru my second season (with the new patches) I've been having all these issues

This is the best Football Manager yet for novice fans of soccer... I mean Football.  *ahem*

They have dumbed it down for us Americans who struggle to pick formations; let along understand how to fully utilize formations.  All this while keeping it complex enough for expert managers who have a full understanding of the game.  Expert managers will find a more in depth system that allows them to experiment or recreate an entirely new formation.

Would you believe that I was running my favorite formation wrong for the last 5 years?

I belive it now.

Been playing FM for a very long time. I buy the game very 2 years and this one is horrid.

Basically, Strikers are pointless, just transfer list them, they won't score.

Enjoy the start of the season, because at the mid season, your players will all develop some kind of brain injury and forget how to play football, the weakest of side will destroy you.

Give up on tactics, they make no difference anymore

Players are contantly injured, an unrealistic amount

Your team will have 15-20 shots on target and might score one goal, your weak opponent will have 2-3 shots and will beat you with 2-3 goals - Seriously, test it with an editor, give yourself the greatest striker and goalie in the world and watch yourself lose and score no goals.

This game is a joke now, SI are don't care about it, they own the market and just take money each years without improving them game beyond a new skin.

This is the last time I buy FM.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Very good game, far better than Football manager 2018 and it's little things like the layouts etc that change the game. I feel like the game is a tad scripted with match results as away games seem impossible to keep a clean sheet, I could have a full 4* defence and still manage to concede 1 or 2 goals a game. Very buggy, however it is early stages of the game releasing so I do hope they get fixed.

The bugs that have been occuring for me are:
Pausing in middle of matches for several seconds, occurs a few times.
At the end of a match sometimes I get a 'players are warming up' message pop up and I am unable to continue resulting in me restarting my game, tried a few things trying to fix it however it doesn't work.

On the scripting side of things I am suspicous of it being a scripted result as my players on some occasions stand still with the ball cluelessly like their soul as left their body and just lose the ball, thus resulting to the opposition getting a chance on goal or majority of the time conceding a goal.

VAR in my opinion is over-used and needs fixing as it gets very annoying after a while. 
On a scale of 1-10 i'd have to rate this game 8.5!

title: Football Manager 2019
review: Massive improvement over 2018. The accumulation of lot's of little touches offer's much better feedback. New Tactic options give a greater feel of control and ability to react in matches. Also makes a good jumping on point for beginners, still a steep learning curve but finally has intergrated tutroials for new players.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: man i want it to give good review but,,im taken aback by the training..not because its feature, but with the overall happiness of my player..nothing will please them..even if u put a session a day...they will always be unhappy...the most annoying things is..they are improving..but the happiness overall is out of control to the point of ANNOYING THE **** out of me..i was try to ignored this..but this taken my joy away season after season..

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
SI should seriously ask themselves whether they are here because they are the only one doing this kind of game or because they have created a geniue good game. 
The only positive point I can find is the training system. It looks really nice. However, all the other parts are a complete mess. This current match engine is the dumbest one I have seen for years. 
-Fullbacks refuse to cross when they are in space and wait for two or three AI players to intercept him. 
-Doesn't matter if you are Ronaldo, Messi, Suarez, Neymar, you STILL MISS one-on-one more times than I could count. 
-You would think that after Guardiola showed Premier League how to play beautiful style. SI would finally try to give possession tactics a bit more ease. But why follow the real world when it doesn't suit you?
-AI goalkeepers are all Superman, like again. AI defenders with 10 speed can outpace 19 speed Dembele, like again. 
-The best way to score as of now is to score from corners but your forward can easily go 10 hours without scoring because no matter how good your front line is, as soon as your oppposition use Ultra-defensive style formation, you can expect them to win by one goal with only one shot. 
-Messi contract in FM is 1.2 million per week but I can't give him a new contract because the highest I can give is 750K. 

But hey, at least we have a new ♥♥♥♥ING purple skin to look at, what a innovation for a whole year. CAN'T WAIT FOR ANOTHER YEAR

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In case someone is missing the point, I'm saying SI is not improving. Their base game is still good but they could do more than just giving me a new UI.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I expected some fan boys to shout "You sucks", but I didn't expect them to just throw random accusations and insults without any sound reasons. Perhaps, this is the reason why SI can get away with♥♥♥♥♥♥like this because they know no matter how bad the design choices are, the community will bash anyone who raise these issues with "You sucks". 
And for these 3 years old who can't understand what my negative review meant, I wished this version to be better than previous 18. The core design of the game is the best one out there, but the current machine engine is so unrealistic, they might as well use the 18 one instead. If you have a whole year to make a newer version, but failed to address the problems in many previous version AND introduced new problems to make the match engine even worse, why shouldn't I dislike about it? If you like it, give a positive review and move on. But shout "Go die" to criticism is just so funny.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: BEST GAME EVER

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I've played FM from 2010 to 2016. I really enjoyed FM 12 the most, and felt that the quality of the game begane to decline after this version. So I skipped FM17 and FM18, but then tried out the demo for FM19 and really enjoyed it. I thought that nearly every part of the game was fleshed out. The game felt very rich in terms of how much you can do or not by leaving it up to your staff. 

The game has revamped a lot of items to make it feel like I'm part of a bigger world than in previous iterations. I enjoy the training aspect of the game because it groups up the players into units, and I don't have to personally set it up. The dynamics page is neat too because it gives an additional dimension to the relationships my players have with me and one another. There's also just so much data that I can sink into and analyze for my team. 

One con though which is that I hate Brexit =(

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
This game is such a mixed bag. The depth is ridiculous but my main issue is that nothing really seems to matter when it comes to match days. I decided to manage chelsea.  I made some good trades bringing on john stones and some lesser known players.  My tactics were well known by the players.  Somehow in my preseason matches i dropped four of six matches to MLS teams including a 4-2 loss to New England who absolutely sucks this year.  I would lose matches despite a 26 to 6 shots on goal differential with about half being on target.

Skip to community shield.  Holy hell....four main players missing from Man City's roster including debruyne and their starting goalier and somehow i still lose 2-1.  I dont know wtf is going on with  whatever engine decides who wins and who loses but the stats are absolutely insane.  I doubled every offensive stat for man city yet still lost.

This to me is a huge issue.  While I never expect to win every match, I think when 4 of your starters are out, you should maybe expect a win.  And you never think a top 3 team in the prem is going to get run by Philadelphia and New York.  

My suggestion is buy the editor and just stack your fucking team.  Whatever little engine that decides winners and losers is fucked.  These matches make no sense but ALWAYS lean towards the side you are playing.  Its kinda fucking ridiculous.


Updated...

Match engine still continues to be a pile of shit.  Tell me how you can continue to rack up 20 to 30 shots per match and score maybe one goal while your opponents get under 5 and have the same amount of gooals or more.  Was playing v West Ham and finally had to turn the fking game off.  After drawing v Gent (29 shots to 3), i was already down to west ham 2 - 0 on  2 shots.  Watching Lucas break away from my defense like they were just standing there was unreal....because thats what it is....un fking real.  Your break aways?  dont worry....every opponent has a super goalie or youll shoot wide or hit the bar over and over and over and over again.  Thank god for the editor.  I have to boost my all ready all star played just to have a chance against shit bottom feeder teams.  Well fking done.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
My love for this game knows nobounds and I've played Football Manager games for 17 years now. Anyone remember CM 00/01? ;) 

FM 19 is a great game. I really like the new tactics and traningsystem, especially the new mentorsystem. The new press conference screen is more fun, even though I tend to let my assistant run the show. 

Also as a fan of the German league, having it fully licensed with pictures and logos is great, no actually it's fantastic. I don't use facepacks or logopacks so for someone like me it makes it really fun when the German league is licensed.

During the current patch there are some flaws/bugs, but nothing that should bother you in the long run because it will be fixed, so I will withhold judgement, relax and sit back and enjoy a great game.

/A Swedish dude

title: Football Manager 2019

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
So far not too impressed, and here are 4 reasons why***:

1. Players are ALWAYS unhappy!!! They do not give you a break, more so than the other games. If a player is in rotation and you don't play them for a few games rest assured they will demand to be transfer listed. 

2. Shouts. Do they do anything???? Often they get 'fired up' but will go on to lose 4 - 0. *sigh*

3. Not sure if I am the only one experiencing this, but I get such bad FPS on the 3D gameplay despite my computer having "5 star" 3D capability (16gb ram, GTX 1060 gc, latest processor ect). Why??? 

4. They've overloaded this game so much, everything just seems so slow and glitchy, not nice and smooth like previous games (although I've found this to be the case with many of the recent versions). This game must require some super computer to be able to run nicely. 

***Now obviously I only have a limited amount of hours on this game (8.6) and I will continue to play it. Just expressing my initial thoughts. So far, would not recommend this game.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: I don't understand why this happens EVERY DAMN SAVE from FM18 to FM19 I have a team playing really well throughout the first half of the season and then all of a sudden the team decides to start having secret meetings behind my back and decide, "you know since were top of the table rn why don't we just screw coach over and throw every game" because immedietly when it hits the half way mark of the season all my players decide to be crap and lose to teams that are fighting for relegation even if were at the top of the table. I don't understand why it happens in all my saves, if there is some type of algorithm that makes this happen wanna let us know Interactive so that we can be prepared to get screwed over. It really pisses me off.
developer_response:
Sorry to hear you've encountered this - I'll try and explain what's happened. Basically at the start of the season AI teams will look at your team and judge the strength of your side. If you're weak and playing 'away' a team will be quite attacking. If you're a mid-table type team, playing at 'home' the AI will attack, 'away' they'll likely be more defensive. And if you're a very strong side, the AI will set up defensively 'home' and 'away'.

Now what happens throughout a season is that the AI look at your results/position in the table and recalculate your strength. So perhaps at the start of the season they took you lightly, thought you were weak and just attacked - your tactic worked in such a way that it performed well against their setup. Now you've played the same team again and they've learnt their lesson - they set up defensively and now your tactic is not as effective. Perhaps they now pick you off on the counter attack for instance.

So essentially what we recommend is be aware of your opposition. Read your opposition scouting reports and familiarise yourself with how your tactics work against certain types of setup. And be wary of over-committing against defensive sides as they will look to exploit on the break. Hope this helps with any mid-season slumps.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
As of the time of this review, the Pre-Game Editor does not work.

While you *can* set up a league structure in the Basic Editor, as soon as you use the "Advanced Rules", the file will not "Verify" which prevents it being used in game.

This means that the good quality leagues found in previous versions of the game cannot be created and added to the Steam Workshop.

The Editor directs any questions to the "Editors Hideaway" on the Sports Interactive website.  The response here from SI is to ignore all questions and delete any threads that might give an appearance that something is wrong, to give the impression that all issues come down to 'user error'.

With SI not adding any actual content other than to update rosters and tweak the system, it is the variety of fantasy leagues etc. added by the community that seems to bring people back to FM year on year.  Therefore a better response should be expected from SI with regard to issues with the Editor.
developer_response:
This is an issue we're aware of with debug errors and something we'll be looking to address very soon.

However just to clarify, as with all previous years we don't officially support editor files from previous versions being compatible when imported into the new game. We do try and offer support where we can (and as stated above we will try and make it easier where we can) but realistically for best results we recommend using data from this version where possible.

Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019

Second half of the season: lost pretty much every game, top strikers doesn't score for 20 games
Entire season: so much information bombarded my head hurts and a ridiculous amount of injuries

All in all this doesn't feel fun it just feels like a part time job

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
This is quite possibly the biggest mess of a FM game I've ever seen. I thought the idea of a public beta was to make it less buggy??

The training is now an incomprehesible mess, goalkeepers dive several seconds after the ball has passed them, defenders stand still/ do a crab-dance instead of closing down, there are framerate drops everywhere (Ryzen 7, RX 580 - it's not my hardware), if the game is in full screen it keeps freezing if you have a dual monitor set up, crosses went from being wayyyy overpowered to being pointless, the ball "hits" players and bounces in the wrong direction. 

What the hell SI?! If you can fix these problems then I'll happily change my review, but unless these issues are fixed, DON'T BOTHER UPGRADING FROM FM18!

Liking it and Definitely worth the cash but as a repeat purchaser I'm unsurprised but dissappointed that the player interactions continue to be tedious and non-intuitive.  A player insists on being transferred because he can't get a work permit, and none of my options for explaining it to his mutinous teammates have anything to do with work permits.  Tried "hey i've got registration requirements" as that seemed closest and got "well you reg'd some trash worse than him" as a response.

Creating tactics is less byzantine and the match engine looks good.

title: Football Manager 2019

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
It has taken roughly 35hrs per season.  I've got 151 hours in game, minus the times when I left the comp to do other stuff and I'd say 35 is about fair.  That is utterly ridiculous.  You spend so much time watching the dates scroll by, the movement of time is interrupted by so many faffy little messages.  I can't sit down and play this, I need something on in the background or it's just a bloody slog.
The gameplay is actually better, I love the way training is done and I love the tactical depth.  Transfer negotions feel like they have a little more push and pull too, but there's still a lot of really daft demands and people always wanting yearly raises.  The graphics are decent, there's a good variety in what you see and the stadiums aren't too bad either.
I don't know if i can complain with 151hrs in the game, but at the same time, there's a lot lacking.  My main bug is that big teams always hammer me, but the rest is competitive.  That's just not realistic.
This is the best FM has ever been, but it is just far too slow.  And no, I don't want FM Touch, because there's hardly any game there.  On a top end gaming laptop like mine this should be much faster.
So I'm deleting this, I don't want a game that takes 35hrs to run a season, I don't want to have to have a tv show on that I am only half paying attention to because the game I'm playing is so slow.

I'm not going to say it's a bad game, there's a lot of good in this, but man, you need so much spare time to get through it.
developer_response:
If you go into the in-game preferences, under 'Interface' click the 'Screen Flow' tab. Here untick 'Visit News Screens Automatically'.

This should mean the game stops less frequently when processing through days. If you still find the game is slow and takes too long to advance, we would recommend starting a smaller game with less active leagues and a smaller database, as the more you have loaded, the more demanding it'll be on your system.

Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Tactics and training looks good but is pretty complicated so takes a bit to get used to. 

Major problems with injuries. I manage 2 teams and both teams have had 4-5 players out 3-4 months and 2 players each out for the season. 

Major problems with match engine - On both teams in my 4 months of management i have scored 10+ own goals against myself and had 5-6 scored for me by the opposition. Which is just as well because your stricker no matter how good they are will miss every single one on one or blaze miles over no matter what the stats. You will also at least once a month have one of your players on the 3d engine pull off a great tackle taking the ball. Get a foul against them have the commentary Say "that didnt look like a foul" then be sent off for "a dangerous two footed challenge" Constantly happens. 

Same issues as previous years teams 2 divisions below you in a cup will have 40 shots against them 30 on  target but you wont see 4 highlights all game and lose 1-0 although this time that goal will 100% be an own goal as per the other issue which makes it even more frustrating. 

Get a refund. Stick to a better older FM its what ill be doing

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
There used to be a time I spent 200+ hours on each release of FM. Then from v2012 onwards that got less and less, and I felt less and less like I knew what I was doing in the game. When the inevitable slump in form came I had absolutely no idea what to do.

My biggest annoyance of the last years has been resolved: the enormous amount of information has been channeled so it is much easier to understand what is going on. I haven't had that famous turn in performance yet, but my hope and expectation right now is that the information screens I see will also give me ways to turn things around, which I felt really was missing in the last version I gave a good try (v2015 I think). The post-match analysis really helps me now to touch up on my tactic and shows what works and doesn't work.

I am really get back the feeling I used to have from the older FM versions, back when I knew what I was doing!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Good game for fan of Spain dvision and preimir division, but for Serie A team fans, this game is completly trash.
Stupid AI trading logic makes Serie A boring and dumb. Serie A team would never buy famours players even with billion dollars in the pocket, the only thing they knew is loan. I start with Milan, in my 2nd season, Juv had sell Rugani, Costa, Cancelo, De Scigilio and only loaned pauliniho. Now Juv only have 17 players in first squad. 
In my beta version game, same situation. 4th seasons, Inter had sale all the players that worth higher than 30M, but did not buy any famous players, Juv had sale every famous players except Ronaldo. Serie A became extremely boring and that's why I start a new game. But the same thing happens.
This is ridiculors, and it is discrimination to the Serie A teams. DON'T YOU EVER NOTICE the investment of Serie A teams for these years???

Seriously, I would never suggest any Serie A fans buy this game unless they take corrective actions.
======================================================================

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
So having played this game for a few hours, where I play in 2D with 3D replays, I feel that the games themself feel beter.
Atleast in the 2D part I'm seeing better saves from keepers, better longshots and individuel actions that even once turned into a goal and not into a shot 50 meters wide like everytime in fm18.

Tactics seem to be followed better and changing tacktics really changes how your team plays even if you have the same formation. This could be because for the beta I'm playing as Ajax and with pretty good players it has that effect, can't say if it does for worse teams.

The rest of the game just feels much of the same, training is nice for those who want to go really deep into it, but for now it feels like a part of the game that I really don't want to put 10 hours in, just so the game can tell me I did it all wrong and so have wasted months of players training. So I just keep it on automatic.
There are alot of smaller changes that really make it alot better to play, like the scouting reports, giving contracts to players that don't demand anything (you can get advise on what a good first draft can look like), the game running a bit better, etc. etc. 

Right now it just feels better than fm18 and that is great seeing as I will play this game alot in the coming year. So even the smaller changes make me really happy that they made them. 

Look, it's not a totaly new game and the graphics are not like fifa or PES, but it did make alot of cool little changes and even a few important ones that make this game feel alot better than fm18. So if you liked that one, you will like this one even better.........but who cares? because you already bought it and are playing it for 500 hours or you don't care and just want to hate on it because it has not so great graphics.

Ow and all this is just me playing for a few hours, so things might changes and if they do I will update this............maybe, if I feel like I care enough.

For now, have a nice day.

Edit #1

After playing a bit more here are the other things I have noticed:

not only are the longshots done alot better this year, you can also now score more than in a blue moon from corners and indirect freekicks.

A thing I have to see how it will develop are the injuries. Right now I feel like they ramped them up, but could be just bad luck. If they are ramped up it could be because they are factoring in your players being tired alot more. in FM18 you really did not care about a player being at high risk of injury, but it could be in FM19 you really have to keep an eye on that.
Although it would be nice if you would not get a message after every game that some players are tired........Yes I get it and I will rotate them next game, please stop bugging me to talk with my players about it because they will just get mad at me for it.......

that was it for now, maybe will be back later. (ow, I allowed comments, did not know those are disabled if you do not check the box, so if you feel I got something wrong or right, let me know)

Edit #2 (last edit)

These are my last thoughts about the game:

I did not get any gamebreaking or really bad bugs, just a few weird things with the stats, but I don't care that much about those and those are already fixed with the full release or are easy enough to fix later.

Like I said in the last edit, you really have to look at the injury risk in this game. If injury risk is high than it's better to give that player a rest next game or you really have a high chance of getting a injury of a few weeks atleast, but I find this to be more realistic than it was the other years. Now players will get tired if they have to play 2 matches in one week and the injury risk is a real thing you have to look at, not something that did not matter and did nothing.

So yeah, in my eyes this is one of the best if not the best FM game in years. 

(even though championship manager 4 is still my favorite ........bless you Makofo and Shabalala, your 20 dribble and around 18 pace and speed where OP but so fun)

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I've been playing SI football manager games since championship manager 2 on MS DOS (1995) and this is the best version ever. 

The new tactical system is brilliant . Now it feels more than ever that you can watch the game and make intuitive tactical changes easily on the fly to counter your opposition.

I love how this game isn't just about the numbers anymore and how man management can transform your players for better or worse in realistic ways. 

In fact all the small things can change what happens on the pitch.... training, media handling, mentoring groups, friendship groups, languages, transfer pressure etc. there's so much depth to this series now!

10/10

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I have insane amount of hours on the last few Football Managers and I can truly say that this is probably one of the best releases in the last 5 years. Man managing has been improved and worked on since last years introduction which makes it a lot more enjoyable for those who enjoy squad building. As a keen tactician I absolutely love the new additions to tactics which makes it a lot easier to play to a defined style or play which alongside fixes to the match engine has allowed tactical styles to feel different to one another instead of all counter attacking, possession, longball tactics feeling the same. Training changes are awesome too giving the game a lot more depth in player development, but the biggest change from this is that I feel like you have to rotate your squad and adjust training accordingly instead of sticking to same old routine all year. Very stable and hasnt crashed on me yet which is great for an early release game. 

10/10 would go undefeated in Ligue 1 only to be denied Champions League bc of FFP again.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Feels better than the bare minimum data update rubbish of recent years.  It feels much better and the response to the things you do seems to make more sense and feel less like a robotic time wasting exercise in doing stuff just because you know it's better if you do despite the mind numbing tedium. In summary, bearing in mind the crap we've been putting up with this last decade or so with this lot, this is definitely a step in the right direction. I think they knew the writing was on the wall and have tried to improve things and listen to their customers rather then take them for granted, so applause for that, but there's still work to be done.

Remember every bug in the game play? Crosses, One v ones always missing, needing to create 30 chances to score 2 goals while the cpu beats you 3-2 with two shots total? - Yeah well all of that nonsense is still there as it always has been. The engine still needs a tear down and rebuild, but they clearly don't have the balls or the will to do so. Niftier graphical representations of action are not going to solve this. It's time to evolve lads and consign this engine to history imo. You've polished this turd to a shiny gleam, it will not polish much further methinks.

Apparentlhy the injuries were sorted for release. I'm a (game time) month in and i've had ten, TEN! 2.5 a week! We haven't played a competitive game yet, my training intensity is low, and i've been giving the players 45-60 minute run outs. It's bloody bonkers! If this is the injury issue fixed, then you need to look again. 

All in all, at first glance it feels like we're getting there, but i feel like it's just better stuff bolted onto the same old problems tbh, and when i've had a decent amount of time to assess what's what, i'll probably end up hating myself for being such an idiot again and giving my cash to people who probably don't deserve it all things considered. Right now though, i like most of what i see.

What these lot need is some decent competition to give them a proper kick up the arse, but i don't see that happening any time soon tbh. If like me you've been bitterly dissapointed with pretty much every release in the last decade or so, then probably you'll see past the gloss, however, that said, this feels like a much better effort and whilst it won't make up for feeling fleeced by these people over the last decade or more, it's certainly now approaching the game it needs to be. They need to be braver and tackle the match engine though, they really do.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: team budgets are way off.  Players are not evaluated properly in line with what we have seen this season. If you want to win the Premier  league with a team outside of the top 6 good luck.
developer_response:
At the start of the game budgets will be calculated as though the money has already been spent (which in real life it largely was (1,256M was spent by top flight English clubs this summer). So we calculate their funds AFTER this spending.

You'll find for the first Winter transfer window and from then on more money will be available. And realistically, teams outside the top 6 would need a huge amount of luck to win the league, certainly in the first season. It wouldn't be a realistic game if that was easy.

Appreciate your feedback, if there's anything you still think is wrong taking into account the info above, you can raise it via our research forums here - https://community.sigames.com/forum/619-database-and-research/

Many thanks.

title: Football Manager 2019
review: Toooooo many injuries and red cards
developer_response:
We released version 19.1.0 to address injuries being too high in matches, so you should notice a difference now. If you're picking up lots of red cards, be aware how much you're pressing and the types of player roles you've picked (such as ball winning midfielders for instance).

Likewise make sure they're not putting in too many hard tackles and are staying on their feet - and if you are having players sent off as from being 'last man' be aware at how high a line you're playing. And good luck!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Another year, another pile of steaming garbage. I mean who the hell is designing their user interfaces? Seriously? Does their UI designer have any education in design what so ever? Glaring purple? Really?

And the alternative skins that come with it? They haven't even taken the time to make sure the text is properly coloured to pop against the background. I, could literally have done a better job at designing the colour schemes of their user interface. Am I some sort of genius who can do anything? No, I just realise that SHOCK purple is a bad idea to fill your screen with and that the colour of your font should be markedly DIFFERENT than the backgrond!

This really speaks to the level of, or rather lack of level of effort.

The interface itself is worse this year. Less intuitive. Less response. Missclicks are the order of the day for tasks you will repeat countless of times.

I bought 2018. Didn't play more than 10 hours or so before going back to 2017. The UI was shit. I got 2019 because I guess I'm an idiot fanboi. And I'm already back to 2017 because the UI is even worse this year.

At what point are you people going to fire whoevers in charge of UI and hire someone with ANY relevant skillset?

The rest of the game is probably fine. I mean it's not as if they change much or need to change much. The match engine looked a bit better than 2018 (did they get a new colour guy? Oh god 2018 had colour issues! it's not perfect this year but it's better at least).

But this is a game all about clicking through menus and reading tons of stats. And it just pains me to try and do that in 2019.

Stop changing things to change them. Make changes based on creating a user friendly experience!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I haven't tried too much of the game yet, but posting my review based on first few hours. I have probably played this series since FM 07, so not a newbie to the game overall. Also note this review as yet, is for the initial beta release (though gameplay doesn't change through editions, so don't expect it would change for beta-final).

1. New Features -
Tactics and training has been overhauled. Overall this "looks" to be a really nice addition. Increase in level of detailing is a nice step too.

2. Tutorials -
Having played every release of this series for over a decade, turned off initial induction module. The new feature induction on the other hand, was pretty annoying. For the polish and overall UX the game gives, this seems very very badly under-designed. Too much text, No way to go back to read again, doesn't sound like great idea. Just play a video reel if navigation is too difficult to code.

3. Match Engine -
Maybe its my tactics or maybe something else. But actual game play is ridiculous. I have had GK miss balls they should be catching in their sleep. Even with high intensity tactics, players would rather die than get into tackles. Track back at corners is ridiculous. In short absolutely no improvement over last year, except perhaps a bit smoother gameplay. 

[UPDATE] : Injuries are frustrating. Even with average workload, I keep on having at least 2-3 injuries per game.


While I completely understand that it might be difficult to add value on every iteration, SI really needs to revamp its match engine which till FM 12-13 was its major asset. If you can't add value to the game there's no need for yearly full releases. Just sell newer databases. UI/UX is always pleasing change, but to be honest its overhyped for it to be the biggest selling point.

It wouldn't be too far otherwise, that FM series will be disrupted just like it did that to CM series a decade ago!

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
This actually feels like a fresh game. As someone who was not planning on purchasing the game this year once I saw the revamp to training and the tactics system I was happy to give it a try. It adds so much more depth to the game and you feel like you actually have more influence over the team. 

It would be helpful though to start with the option to use the tactic closest to what is used in real life. As someone not adept with knowing what tactics many teams use in real life when I begin as manager I'm asked to set up a tactic. I have selected some then realised that it doesn't suit the players I have so I have to scrap it and try something else. A default option for each team would be handy for less experienced users. 

The medical center needs to monitor minutes played NOT games played. Telling me a player has played 4 games in the past 2 weeks isn't helpful when I know that I have only used the player as a sub for 10 minutes in each of those games. And saying that this player is at an increased injury risk because of this tells me there is some seriously flawed programming. Switch it to minutes played so I can better monitor game time for my players. How this hasen't happened years ago baffles me. 

The ball physics are improved and some nice skills with the ball are added for the players. The highlights are slightly more interesting to watch...though I am sick of still seeing players kicking the ball into the back of players infront of them as if they didn't notice they were there. Sometimes the players act as though they are stuck in mud, a missed penalty that is blocked straight back at the penalty taker and they do not move, there needs to be that reflex action, this happens in other areas too. 
I would have liked to see the press confrences improved as they're just as boring as ever and I'll skip them every time, though they have added more visible response by players. The few that I have taken has left me puzzled by some of the player reactions and even less inclined to ever answer a question. 
I would love to see more interaction with players available, as a manager I would like to be able to talk to players differently based on their personality. Everyone is different and can't always be treated the same, having the option to encourage a player to improve in training without having to first tell them that you're unhappy with their training would be useful as there are too many negative responses when criticising training. 

The social feed is an absolute waste of space, immediately turned off. I don not want or need fake social media in any game I play. How does fake twitter users tweets help in any way? It doesn't add anything to the game except the hassle of turning it all off. Time wasted that should have been used improving other areas, though it seems the same as last year so no wasted time this year really. 

Vast improvemnet and a stepping stone to build upon next year.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
You've done it, SI. You've finally made me purchase this title in back-to-back years. I normally wait a year or two before buying a new FM, but this year you added enough changes that impact the tactical side to warrant a buy. It's in beta but runs smoothly for me. I think I've only encountered a small UI glitch when pressing "continue" to simulate but I've found if I hit the back button then hit continue, all is well. No crashes yet.

I love the new tactical control, the mentoring system and practice engine. Unlike what other viewers have said, if you don't want to go through the tutorials, there is a skip option. For those new to the game, the tutorials are a must and serve a purpose. Is FM worth your money this year? Absolutely.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Certainly one of the best iterations of the series in a long time.  Tactics finally feel like they make a real difference, with players actually seeming to implement what you have asked for (at last).  Example: 0-0 at half time in pre-season friendly in a game we are expected to win - we've played ok first half but looking a bit shot shy up front and a bit laborous in the build up.  I tell them at half-time to keep going and the win will come. Instruct the strikers to take the game by the scruff of the neck and make the difference. Ask for a quicker tempo and a more attacking mindset. Ask my best winger to up his game and start  getting in more crosses.  Tell the full backs to push on and support the wingers.  I kid you not - everything I asked for was apparent in the 2nd half - crosses start flying in - 2 goals from my strikers - my best winger much improved.  I shout from the touchline a few times to praise the team - and they seem to up their game with the added encouragement.  Last 15 mins we start to tire and the opposition start to get more of the ball - we are too open now so i stick on a DM and tell them to keep it simple, mark tightly and see the game out.  We win 2-0 and I praise them to the hilt for a great 2nd half.  This isn't just a one off, but it's the best example I can give of you actually feeling like you are making a difference.  I have never felt this in an FM game previously.

I'm in no way a fan-boi and have slated FM somewhat in the past for some piss-poor attempts.  This year though, things are looking very promising.  Training too - oh my lord - it's what I've been looking for for ages, a joy to micro-manage if that's what you want.  Sending your players on team bonding days and for community outreach sessions to build morale etc - superb stuff. Also, the 3D match, while not making huge strides forward, certainly feels far more polished.

If you are in any doubt about purchasing this year, as I was, I can wholeheartedly say that you are safe to take the plunge.  While it may not be perfect - it is certainly far closer to it than ever before.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Coming from someone that buys the game every year and puts in thousands of hours on each version.    I can say that this year's game is one of the best improvements from the prior year's version.    Outside of all of the new features the game runs much smoother overall.    

If I had to pick out one new feature that adds to the game I would say the training system.   I really enjoy setting up training as a team and for each player.  The system makes sense and allows you to add some variety to specialize as needed.      It is still too early to tell as to how may training choices will work out,  but I feel more involved then ever before with the system.

I don't always recommend jumping on the new version at release but this year I would give it a thumbs up.   Get the game now, its worth the full cost.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
I will only compare this to its predecessor - Football Manager 2018, a game I played for like 160 hours and hated every minute of it.

FM19 keeps the "futuristic" complicated interface that makes it hard to see the simple stuff, but improved it massively. It solved most of the issues I had with FM18 - like the fact that compared to FM17, you had to go to a separate menu for opposition instructions rather than being the first thing you see before a game. They fixed that and I am so happy! 

The 3d match engine is WAY better. Regen faces seem better, but you will still need to install a mod pack to fix them and make them actually good. 

What I love is the new tactics system - it will actually create a tactic for you based on a preferred playstyle.

The training system is so much more complicated, which means it will work better than previous version once you completely understand it.

Also, FM19 beta seems to work quicker than FM18 full version(less lag - playing on a high-end computer, btw. No need to play down my specs and say that's why FM18 was lagging - it was not, unless an 8th gen 8086k paired with a 1080Ti and 32GB of Ram are not enough for it.)

For now, I like it better than FM18, but still prefer my simplistic FM17 save. Great buy tho! 
PS: Remember it's still beta. It will improve massively over time.

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
TLDR Version:
By far the best version of the game I have played in ages. The immersion level is immense, The UI is way better than FM18. The game smoothly on my 8 year old Windows machine and my 2014 model Macbook. The tactical creator has been revamped with visual indicators that actually tell you why there is a big gap between attack and defence. The tactical presets help the noob player + the veteran player who understands the Team Instructions is just gonna pick it and race ahead.  New set piece instructions. The match engine is an improvement over FM18, though i still think there are some improvements that can be made. Eden Hazard plays like Eden Hazard in real life.


Training is very immersive, with more control. Tactics and training are linked, you can actually see the style of play work.Scouting what a change, more helpful scouting centre. And lets not forget the small little QOL changes in the view, like tab reordering and separators for custom views. 

Negatives: Collision physics not in the game, which is disappoininting was hoping it would make it. The graphics engine looks good, animations still need a bit of work, some iffy animations that can be improved. 

Where FM18 was 5/10 for me, FM19 is a heavy 8/10. I would definitely recommend this game to any diehard FM fan. If you want great graphics, play FIFA. If you want an immersive all action game that makes you feel like a manager on the sidelines, FM19 is the best version to date

title: Football Manager 2019

title: Football Manager 2019
review:
Hi peeps,
Pre orderd and started right away from day one (beta).  Played 4.5 hrs and would probably continue but it was too late. Let me say this is by far the best experience in recent years. Tactics really matter and are wonderfully done. What I like is that is actually visible in 3d match. Training is maybe most refreshing cause it 's onteresting and you can tailor it as you wish. Change it when you want, just many options. 
Oh lets not forget UI is best default ever. Larger fonts for clubs and changing colors in general look very transparent ... good choice SI.

All in all 9.5/10.

Highly recommend!
